publication.abstract: © 2017 Nature America, Inc., part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved. We report webKnossos, an in-browser annotation tool for 3D electron microscopic data. webKnossos provides flight mode, a single-view egocentric reconstruction method enabling trained annotator crowds to reconstruct at a speed of 1.5 ± 0.6 mm/h for axons and 2.1 ± 0.9 mm/h for dendrites in 3D electron microscopic data from mammalian cortex. webKnossos accelerates neurite reconstruction for connectomics by 4- to 13-fold compared with current state-of-the-art tools, thus extending the range of connectomes that can realistically be mapped in the future.
publication.title: WebKnossos: Efficient online 3D data annotation for connectomics

summary.description: Online 3D annotation tool for distributed large-scale data analysis in light- and electron-microscopy based connectomics.
summary.name: webKnossos
